title: Top 10 PTE Speaking Tips to Boost Your Score
description: Master the PTE Speaking section with these essential tips. Learn how to improve fluency, pronunciation, and time management for a 79+ score.
author: PTE Expert
content:
1. Maintain Oral Fluency

Fluency is key in PTE. Do not hesitate or self-correct. Keep speaking at a steady matching your natural pace.

2. Focus on Pronunciation

Speak clearly and enunciate your words. You don't need a native accent, but you must be understood by the computer.

3. Describe Image Structure

Use a template for Describe Image. Identify the title, axes, and key trends. Conclude with a prediction or summary.

4. Retell Lecture Note-taking

Write down keywords, not sentences. Use arrows to connect ideas and reconstruct the lecture flow.

5. Microphone Position

Place the microphone parallel to your nose, about 2-3 fingers away. Avoid breathing directly into it to prevent popping sounds.

6. Don't Stop Speaking

If you make a mistake, keep going. Stopping or correcting yourself will hurt your fluency score more than the mistake itself.

7. Use Intonation

Vary your pitch to sound natural. Monotone speech can be interpreted as robotic and lower your score.

8. Practice Read Aloud

Read with purpose. Stress important words and pause effectively at punctuation marks.

9. Answer Short Question

Keep your answers brief. Usually, one or two words are enough. Don't overcomplicate it.

10. Stay Calm

Anxiety affects breathing and speech rate. Take a deep breath before each task and focus on the screen.
